Good morning. We will be having out last rallies in Karamoja sub region today. I have been warmly received here and I thank you.
Yesterday while with the people of Kotido, I asked them to keep hope alive. And through hope we would have change.
Kotido and Karamoja in particular remains an underdeveloped area. Not enough has been done or perhaps the wrong intervention.
Education shall be a priority for the area under the #GoForward government. Education for girls is very important.
One of the changes under my government shall be in ownership of land. This is a big problem in the area.
Land and minerals of Karamoja have to be protected for this generation and generations to come. Karamoja shall have special consideration.
I don't agree with those who say they are waiting for Karamoja to develop. Special attention has to be taken to allow this development.
This development must take into consideration the views and attitudes of Karamoja.
Finally to achieve all of this in Karamoja we need peace and a government that is at peace with its citizens.
Thank you the people of Kanawat for coming to hear our message.

Yesterday I spoke about my experience in government working in various Ministries. How it has given me understanding of how government works
Government works efficiently when strong institutions exists. This is why I am standing. I believe we must build strong institutions.
This is the first change that I under the #GoForward platform will ensure. That we build strong institutions and fill all vacancies.
I therefore am a candidate for "Change". Change in how we work, efficiency, and output.
I do believe that as a Country, we must prepare for a transition. We have never had peaceful transition from one generation to the next.
It is this transition that shall keep us on the path of progress. So we must identify and nurture the next generation and prepare for this.
Protecting the future starts now by protecting the vote. My interactions across the Country shows overwhelming support for change.
Safeguarding this change starts now before the vote. Be vigilant. Ensure your household is informed and your neighbours hear the message.
Keep the spirit of change alive. Even when you are discouraged you keep going. On voting day, leave no one at home.
Our aspirations as Ugandans is for a better Uganda. Exodus 14:15 talks about children of God going forward. Let us move forward peacefully.
Tororo has great potential especially if a lot of emphasis is put for industrialization. The people are hardworking with good work ethics.
TDA (U)/Go Forward through programmes such as the advanced Subcounty model, jobs for all, universal healthcare, etc will enable this change.
When I started this journey in June 2015, I said then that we have 8 key pillars for dev't. We have spoken on all of these at each rally.
1) we must revive our democracy and government institutions - 8 #GoForward pillars
2) We must transform the economy and attract heavy local and foreign investment - 8 #GoForward pillars
3) We must promote equitable development where all communities and all regions of Uganda equally benefit from decisions made by the gov't.
4) We must provide jobs that are fit for the 21st century - 8 #GoForward pillars
5) Ensure a greater level of accountability on the part of all leaders and make a stronger effort at fighting corruption at all levels.
6) Reinforce the observance of and respect for the Rule of Law while ensuring Security for all - 8 #GoForward pillars
7) Provide good quality healthcare - 8 #GoForward pillars
8) We must enhance the quality of education while addressing the skills gap that is our future, our promise - 8 #GoForward pillars
